concepts.name: Linear Systems of Equations
concepts.description: A collection of two or more linear equations involving the same set of variables, solved together to find where their graphs intersect.

concepts.name: Graphical Solution of Systems
concepts.description: Finding the solution to a system of equations by graphing each equation and identifying the intersection point(s).

concepts.name: Substitution Method
concepts.description: A technique for solving systems of equations by solving one equation for a variable and substituting this expression into another equation.

concepts.name: Elimination Method
concepts.description: A technique for solving systems of equations by adding or subtracting equations to eliminate one variable and solve for the other.

concepts.name: Applications of Systems
concepts.description: Using systems of equations to solve real-world problems like cost comparison, motion problems, and mixture problems.

concepts.name: Graphing Inequalities
concepts.description: Graphing the solution set of linear inequalities by shading the appropriate regions on the coordinate plane.

concepts.name: Systems of Inequalities
concepts.description: Solving multiple inequalities together by finding the overlapping shaded region that satisfies all constraints.

concepts.name: Linear Programming
concepts.description: A method of optimizing a linear objective function subject to a set of linear constraints, often involving inequalities.

concepts.name: Special Types of Systems
concepts.description: Identifying systems as consistent, inconsistent, or dependent based on the relationship between the equations' graphs.

concepts.name: Optimization Problems
concepts.description: Maximizing or minimizing an objective function under a set of constraints, often using vertices of the feasibility region.

concepts.name: Bounded and Unbounded Solutions
concepts.description: Classifying solution regions of inequalities as bounded (finite area) or unbounded (extends infinitely).

concepts.name: Real-World Linear Programming
concepts.description: Applying linear programming techniques to practical scenarios like investment optimization and resource allocation.

concepts.name: Intersection Points in Systems
concepts.description: Calculating points where equations intersect as solutions to systems, especially in optimization and application contexts.
